Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, august 20th. it's been a whirlwind in the tech world as microsoft announces a new commitment to environmental sustainability. the tech giant pledges to become carbon negative by 2030, meaning it plans to remove more carbon from the atmosphere than it emits. ceo satya nadella stated that this ambitious goal will see investments in clean energy, energy-efficient data centers, and initiatives to support carbon capture technology.

meanwhile, amazon has unveiled its latest line of smart home devices, including a new echo speaker equipped with advanced ai capabilities. the move is seen as amazon's attempt to strengthen its foothold in the burgeoning smart home market. with voice recognition improvements and expanded compatibility with other smart home products, amazon aims to be a leader in the interconnected world of smart devices.

shares of netflix are under pressure today after the streaming service reported subscriber growth below analysts' expectations. despite releasing high-profile content, competition from new streaming platforms remains a challenge, putting strain on netflix's ability to expand its audience base. the company acknowledged the competitive landscape but expressed confidence in its upcoming slate of original programming.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, august 20th. microsoft is making headlines with its bold new environmental commitment. the company has pledged to become carbon negative by 2030, aiming to remove more carbon from the atmosphere than it emits. ceo satya nadella announced this ambitious plan, which includes investments in clean energy, energy-efficient data centers, and carbon capture technologies.

in other news, amazon is expanding its smart home lineup. the tech giant has unveiled a new echo speaker featuring advanced ai capabilities. this move is part of amazon's strategy to solidify its position in the competitive smart home market. with enhanced voice recognition and broader compatibility with other smart devices, amazon is positioning itself as a leader in the interconnected world of smart technology.

meanwhile, netflix shares are taking a hit today after the streaming giant reported subscriber growth that fell short of analyst expectations. despite releasing a slate of high-profile content, the company faces fierce competition from emerging streaming platforms. while acknowledging the challenges, netflix remains optimistic about its upcoming original programming.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-348 Microsoft's Carbon Negative Pledge 🌍, Amazon's Smart Home Expansion 🏠, Netflix's Subscriber Struggles 📉
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for wednesday, august 20th! delve into the latest impactful tech updates:

  • microsoft's environmental pledge: the tech giant aims to become carbon negative by 2030, investing in clean energy, efficient data centers, and carbon capture technologies under ceo satya nadella's leadership.
  • amazon's smart home expansion: unveils a new echo speaker with advanced ai capabilities, strengthening its foothold in the smart home market with enhanced voice recognition and broader device compatibility.
  • netflix subscriber growth struggles: despite high-profile content releases, netflix faces challenges with lower-than-expected subscriber growth amidst rising competition from new streaming platforms, but remains positive about future programming.

join us tomorrow for more tech insights!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image featuring a lush, green earth from space, signifying microsoft's carbon negative pledge. the earth is cradled by transparent, futuristic buildings representing amazon's expansion into smart homes, with gleaming solar panels reflecting the sun's rays. scattered among the structures are sleek, interconnected smart devices, with subtle digital networks linking them. in the background, a fluid graph line gently dips downward, symbolizing netflix's subscriber struggles, carefully integrated into the skyline without overwhelming the scene. the elements blend harmoniously, creating a unified visual that showcases environmental responsibility, smart technology growth, and the challenges of digital streaming in a modern landscape
